Mobile Notary at Southwest Detention Center

On-site notarization for inmates at Riverside County's southwest area detention facility in Murrieta

Call (213) 933‑2507 Text Us

About Southwest Detention Center

The Southwest Detention Center, also known as the Cois M. Byrd Detention Center, is located in the French Valley area between Murrieta and Temecula in southwest Riverside County. Operational since 1993, this facility is operated by the Riverside County Sheriff's Department and houses male inmates only.

Southwest Detention Center is approximately 1.5 hours from Los Angeles via the I-15 freeway. The facility serves the communities of Murrieta, Temecula, Lake Elsinore, Wildomar, and surrounding areas. Note that the Southwest Detention Center and Cois M. Byrd Detention Center refer to the same facility — they are sometimes listed under either name in inmate locator systems.

Address: 30755-B Auld Rd, Murrieta, CA 92563

Main phone: (951) 696-3050

Visit scheduling: (951) 696-3470 (daily, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM)

Operated by: Riverside County Sheriff's Department

Also known as: Cois M. Byrd Detention Center

Housing: Male inmates only

Public visiting: By appointment only — call one day in advance to schedule

Visit length: Approximately 45 minutes; max 2 visits per inmate per week

Attorney/special visits: Contact the facility directly at (951) 696-3050 to schedule

Location: French Valley area (Murrieta/Temecula), approximately 1.5 hours from LA via I-15

Why inmates at Southwest need notary services

  • Time-sensitive legal matters — Court deadlines, plea agreements, and filings that cannot wait until release.
  • Power of attorney — Authorizing a spouse, family member, or attorney to handle finances, property, or legal matters while in custody.
  • Real estate transactions — Signing deeds, refinancing documents, or property transfers with hard deadlines.
  • Family law documents — Divorce paperwork, custody agreements, and support modifications requiring notarized signatures.
Planning a wedding at Southwest Detention Center? If you need a full ceremony instead of or in addition to document notarization, see our jail wedding services for Southwest Detention Center (Cois M. Byrd) →

Common Documents for Southwest Inmates

Powers of attorney & authorizations

  • General power of attorney
  • Limited or special power of attorney
  • Durable power of attorney for finances
  • Healthcare power of attorney / advance directive
  • DMV power of attorney for vehicle transfers
  • Bank and financial institution authorizations

Real estate documents

  • Grant deeds and quitclaim deeds
  • Refinancing and loan modification paperwork
  • Property sale and escrow documents
  • Lease agreements and rental authorizations

Court & legal documents

  • Declarations and affidavits
  • Divorce responses and stipulations
  • Child custody and visitation agreements
  • Probate and estate documents
  • Civil case filings and responses

Other documents

  • Vehicle title transfers
  • Business authorizations and resolutions
  • Immigration-related affidavits
  • Insurance claims and benefit forms
  • Any document requiring a notarized signature

Scheduling a Notary Appointment at Southwest

  1. Contact us with the inmate's information

    Call or text with the inmate's full legal name, booking number (if known), and a description of the documents that need to be notarized. Let us know your deadline so we can prioritize scheduling.

  2. We coordinate with the facility

    Riverside County facilities require visits to be scheduled at least one day in advance. For attorney or professional visits at Southwest, we contact the facility directly at (951) 696-3050 to coordinate. Due to the distance from Los Angeles, we plan the trip carefully to ensure timely arrival.

  3. Prepare your documents

    Have all documents ready and complete before the appointment — we cannot draft legal documents, only notarize signatures. If the inmate needs to review documents first, coordinate with their attorney or use the facility's mail system.

  4. The notary appointment

    We travel from Los Angeles to Southwest Detention Center in Murrieta (approximately 1.5 hours via I-15), clear security screening, and meet with the inmate in the designated visiting area. The inmate confirms their identity, signs the documents in our presence, and we complete the notarization.

  5. Document delivery

    After the appointment, we return the signed and notarized documents to you, your attorney, escrow company, or other designated recipient — by hand delivery, courier, or mail depending on your timeline.

Tip: The Southwest Detention Center is also known as the Cois M. Byrd Detention Center. If you're searching for an inmate, try both names in the Riverside County inmate locator. This facility houses male inmates only.

Southwest Notary Fees

Jail notarizations at Southwest Detention Center require travel from Los Angeles to Murrieta, coordination with facility staff, security screening, and wait time. Pricing reflects the distance and complexity of working within the facility's procedures.

Southwest appointments: Starting at $325

  • Price includes travel to Southwest (30755-B Auld Rd, Murrieta), coordination, wait time, and notarization
  • Additional signatures at the same appointment may be added for a reduced fee
  • Rush or same-day appointments may have additional fees based on availability

What is included

  • Travel from Los Angeles to Southwest Detention Center and back
  • Coordination with facility procedures
  • Security screening and wait time
  • Notarization of documents (California notary fees per signature)
  • Return of documents to you or your designated recipient

Final pricing depends on the number of documents, any special circumstances, and timing. Call or text for a quote based on your specific situation.

Southwest Notary FAQs

Where is the Southwest Detention Center?

Southwest is located at 30755-B Auld Rd, Murrieta, CA 92563, in the French Valley area between Murrieta and Temecula. It is approximately 1.5 hours from Los Angeles via I-15.

Is the Southwest Detention Center the same as Cois M. Byrd?

Yes. The Southwest Detention Center and Cois M. Byrd Detention Center are the same facility. It may be listed under either name in inmate locator systems.

How do I find out if someone is at Southwest?

Search the Riverside County Sheriff's inmate locator online or call (951) 696-3050 with the inmate's name and date of birth.

How do I schedule a visit at Southwest?

Call (951) 696-3470 between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM daily. Visits must be scheduled at least one day in advance. For attorney or professional visits, contact (951) 696-3050.

Does Southwest house women?

No. Southwest houses male inmates only. If you are looking for a female inmate in Riverside County, check the Robert Presley Detention Center or contact the Riverside County Sheriff.

How long does a notary appointment at Southwest take?

Plan for 4 to 5 hours total including travel from Los Angeles (approximately 1.5 hours each way via I-15), security screening, wait time, and the signing.

Need notary services at a different facility?

We provide mobile notary services at jails and detention centers throughout Riverside County, Los Angeles County, and Southern California.

Other Riverside County facilities

  • Robert Presley Detention Center (Riverside)
  • Larry D. Smith Correctional Facility (Banning)

Los Angeles County facilities

  • Men's Central Jail (Los Angeles)
  • Twin Towers Correctional Facility
  • Century Regional Detention Facility (Lynwood)
  • Pitchess Detention Center (Castaic)
  • North County Correctional Facility (Castaic)
  • MDC Los Angeles (Federal)

San Bernardino County facilities

  • West Valley Detention Center (Rancho Cucamonga)
  • Glen Helen Rehabilitation Center (Devore)
  • Central Detention Center (San Bernardino)
  • High Desert Detention Center (Adelanto)

Not sure which jail? Call or text with the inmate's name and we can help locate them and coordinate the appointment.
